discussion.content: 'The data does not need to be immediately ingested into Marketing Cloud...' so definitely not API then. Should be D.

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters wants to import new contacts gathered from an external web form. The entries are being collected at high frequency, potentially thousands per minute. The data does not need to be immediately ingested into Marketing Cloud as it is used in a daily scheduled automation.

What should be recommended?

choices.A: Push each new record into Marketing Cloud via Platform Event API on form submit.
choices.B: Create this as a Journey Data Source via Journey Builder.
choices.D: Perform a daily bulk export to SFTP for import via Automation.
choices.C: Recreate this external web form inside Marketing Cloud.

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters wants to send a Marketing Cloud email immediately after the email address on a Salesforce Contact record changes.

Without writing an APEX trigger, what should the consultant use to meet this requirement?

discussion.content: "Use triggered email sends to create and send automated messages to Salesforce contacts, leads, or person accounts when object records are created or updated." Should be A.
Shouldn't the answer be frequency is too high?

Selected Answer: A
Email going out less after preference center updating and we are sending email on based on filtered audience who has shoes. I vote for A

Makes sense. Frequency too high could be an answer if journey builder is not used, however, being the frequency too high doesn't answer why are less emails send. We could assume that due to the frequency contacts are unsubscribing but that is leaving the problem to a subscriber action. To be fair most of the time when troubleshooting we usually check on if we did something wrong in our configuration, which could be the case for option B and also centered on the Consultant.

Selected Answer: C
I also think answer is C.

comments.content: After reading Jenkd comments B actually makes sense.

discussion.content: it does not say is Journey Builder used but, if Journey Builder was used as evaluated all contacts admitting those with shoes and rejecting those without upon entry evaluation and only allowed entry to those with shoes, rejecting entry of persons without shoes. When/if those rejected persons later have shoes they are not accepted because they had already been evaluated in which case cause would be 'Journey Builder High Water Mark'

questions.question_text:
If I want to introduce a new line of footwear. I am excluding anyone who does not have shoe as an attribute listed in their preference center. I plan to send the emails daily. After a short time, I notice many people updating their preferences, and less emails are going out.
What is the issue causing less emails to go out?

discussion.content:
A
is the right answer indeed

questions.question_text:
During discovery, the customer outlines data requirements and the anticipated use of Marketing Cloud with the following criteria:
✑ Customer data will be fully refreshed every night via Import File Activity from the customer's data warehouse.
✑ Contact records will be augmented by relational data tables via Contact Builder.
✑ Customer ID will be used as the unique identifier for each contact.
Which statement differentiates the use of data extensions over lists?

choices.C: Data extensions can store HTML code as an attribute.
choices.A: Data extensions are necessary for Contact Builder.
choices.B: Data extensions allow for add/update Import File Activity.
choices.D: Data extensions support Customer ID to be used as Subscriber Key.

questions.question_text:
Subscribers are collected on a customer's website whose subscription database of record is Salesforce Marketing Cloud. The customer sends up to five emails per week based on subscriber activity. The list is:
✑ Compiled in a database in the website Content Management System (CMS).
✑ Imported into Marketing Cloud nightly at 11 p.m.
What action should be taken if a third party is sending a message for the customer outside of Marketing Cloud?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
A is correct
Yes, B would be the perfect solution, but is not needed. Unsubscribe management by an automation would be valid as well. So A is correct

choices.B: They will need to integrate with the Marketing Cloud SOAP API.
choices.C: Engagement metrics will be passed into Marketing Cloud.
choices.D: The third-party send list should be pulled from the CMS.
choices.A: Unsubscribes should be synchronized between senders.
